full_summary:
**English to French Translation Services**
**Tender Reference:** PW-23-01024095 Amend 4
**Sollicitation Number:** 182435/A

**Project Overview:**
The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) is soliciting proposals for English to French translation services. The successful Bidder will be awarded a contract to provide translation services on an as-and-when-required basis.

**Key Project Details:**

* Up to 8 contracts may be awarded
* Documents may vary from 50 to 50,000 words
* Period of contract: April 1, 2023, to March 31, 2024
* Option to extend contract for up to 2 additional 2-year periods
* Contractor will be paid in accordance with the applicable provisions as set out in the Basis of Payment

**Important Notes:**

* Bids submitted electronically will be accepted as official
* Bids submitted in-person, by fax, or by courier will not be accepted
* Maximum email file size: 20 MB
* Emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted

**Request for Autonomous Examen:**
A mandatory written examination will be conducted on February 23, 2023, at 11:00 a.m. The Bidder will be required to translate a document within 1 hour of receiving the request.

**Enquiries and Renseignements:**
Technical and contractual enquiries must be submitted in writing to procurement-approvisionnements@cihr-irsc.gc.ca no later than 3 calendar days prior to the tender closing date.

**Documents:**
Bid documents are available on the Government of Canada's tendering service at www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities. The Bidder is encouraged to review the documents in both official languages.

**Trade Agreements:**
This solicitation is governed by the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Regions of Opportunity:**
Canada

**Regions of Delivery:**
National Capital Region (NCR)

**Contracting Entity Name:**
Canadian Institutes of Health Research

**Contact:**
For more information, please contact Sonia Beauchesne, procurement-approvisionnements@cihr-irsc.gc.ca.

**Document Attachments:**
 Please see attachments below: [Provide hyperlinks to attachments]

Note: You cannot exceed 400 words. Therefore, keep the information concise and to the point. Use proper formatting and title your sections to help with readability. 

Please do
